meanings.definition: Resembling a block in shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The toy car was blockier than the sleek race car.
meanings.sent2: The building had a blockier design compared to the modern skyscraper.
meanings.sent3: The blockier puzzle piece just wouldn't fit no matter how hard I tried.
meanings.sent4: Her blockier handwriting made it difficult to read the note.
meanings.sent5: The blockier rocks were harder to stack without toppling over.

meanings.definition: Tending to obstruct or impede progress.
meanings.sent1: The blockier traffic slowed down our journey.
meanings.sent2: His blockier attitude made it challenging to reach a compromise.
meanings.sent3: The blockier rainclouds seemed determined to ruin our picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her blockier opinions clashed with the rest of the group.
meanings.sent5: The blockier obstacles on the path made it harder to navigate.

meanings.definition: To obstruct or hinder movement or progress.
meanings.sent1: Please don't blockier the entrance with your bags.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree blockiered the road, causing a traffic jam.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally blockiered the hallway with the chair I was moving.
meanings.sent4: The construction work blockiered the usual route to the park.
meanings.sent5: His stubbornness blockiered any chance of a peaceful resolution.
